Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for database size, performance, scalability, and redundancy. Identify the applications and services that will use the database.
Design the database architecture, including the choice of single server or flexible server deployment, high availability options, and integration with existing systems.
Choose the appropriate pricing tier based on performance requirements, storage needs, and budget constraints.
Create and configure the Azure Database for PostgreSQL instance in the Azure portal or using Azure CLI/PowerShell.
Set up firewall rules, virtual network integration, and access control policies to secure the database instance.
Ensure data encryption at rest and in transit using Azure's built-in encryption features.

Tasks.Task: Set Up Backup and Restore Policies
Tasks.Task Description: Configure automated backups and define restore policies to ensure data resiliency.
Set up high availability configurations, such as read replicas or zone-redundant deployments, to ensure database uptime.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor and other tools to track database performance and health.
Perform thorough testing of the database performance, including query execution times and load handling.
Document the database setup, configurations, and operational procedures for future reference and training.
Ensure the database setup meets all regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to verify compliance and security postures.
Conduct training sessions for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting the database setup.
